00016 
00017 package WeBWorK::File::Classlist;
00018 use base qw/Exporter/;
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::File::Classlist - parse and write classlist files.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 use IO::File;
00029 
00030 our $MIN_FIELDS = 9;
00031 our $MAX_FIELDS = 11;
00032 
00033 our @FIELD_ORDER = qw/student_id last_name first_name status comment
00034 section recitation email_address user_id password permission/;
00035 
00036 our @EXPORT = qw/parse_classlist write_classlist/;
00037 
00038 sub parse_classlist($) {
00039     my ($file) = @_;
00040     
00041     my $fh = new IO::File($file, "<")
00042         or die "Failed to open classlist '$file' for reading: $!\n";
00043     
00044     my (@records);
00045     
00046     while (<$fh>) {
00047         chomp;
00048         next if /^#/;
00049         next unless /\S/;
00050         s/^\s*//;
00051         s/\s*$//;
00052         
00053         my @fields = split /\s*,\s*/, $_, -1; # -1 == don't delete empty trailing fields
00054         my $fields = @fields;
00055         if ($fields < $MIN_FIELDS) {
00056             warn "Skipped invalid line $. of classlist '$file': expected at least $MIN_FIELDS fields, got $fields fields.\n";
00057             next;
00058         }
00059         
00060         if ($fields > $MAX_FIELDS) {
00061             my $extra = $fields - $MAX_FIELDS;
00062             warn "$extra extra fields in line $. of classlist '$file' ignored.\n";
00063             $fields = $MAX_FIELDS;
00064         }
00065         
00066         my @fields_in_this_record = @FIELD_ORDER[0 .. $fields-1];
00067         my @data_in_this_record = @fields[0 .. $fields-1];
00068         
00069         my %record;
00070         @record{@fields_in_this_record} = @data_in_this_record;
00071         
00072         push @records, \%record;
00073     }
00074     
00075     $fh->close;
00076     
00077     return @records;
00078 }
00079 
00080 sub write_classlist($@) {
00081     my ($file, @records) = @_;
00082     
00083     my $fh = new IO::File($file, ">")
00084         or die "Failed to open classist '$file' for writing: $!\n";
00085     
00086     print $fh '# Generated by $Id$', "\n";
00087     print $fh "# Field order: ", join(",", @FIELD_ORDER), "\n";
00088     
00089     foreach my $i (0 .. $#records) {
00090         my $record = $records[$i];
00091         unless (ref $record eq "HASH") {
00092             warn "Skipping record $i: not a reference to a hash.\n";
00093             next;
00094         }
00095         
00096         my %record = %$record;
00097         my @fields = @record{@FIELD_ORDER};
00098         
00099         my $string = join ",", @fields;
00100         
00101         print $fh "$string\n";
00102     }
00103     
00104     $fh->close;
00105 }
00106 
00107 1;
